SEARCH
Package nz.ac.wgtn.swen225.lc.domain.state

Class GameModel

java.lang.Object
nz.ac.wgtn.swen225.lc.domain.state.GameModel
public class GameModel extends Object
Represents the current state of the game. This class also possesses the ability to update listeners when it changes (through PropertyChangeListener)
Author:
rakenajack

  • Method Details

    • levelId

      public String levelId()
      The ID of the level currently being played.

    • levelNumber

      public int levelNumber()
      The number of the level currently being played. This is used to advance the level.

    • setHelpMessage

      public void setHelpMessage(String helpMessage)
      Sets the help message shown when the player walks over an info tile.

    • helpMessage

      public String helpMessage()

    • levelNumber

      public void levelNumber(int newLevelNumber)
      Sets the current level number, and updates listeners.

    • agents

      public List<Agent> agents()
      Returns a list of all agents and their current state.

    • setAgents

      public void setAgents(List<Agent> agents)
      Sets the list of agents.

    • notifyAgentUpdate

      public void notifyAgentUpdate()
      Notifies all listeners that agent state has changed.

    • tiles

      public Tile[][] tiles()
      Returns the 2D array representing all tiles in the game. This does not take into account the viewable area.

    • keys

      public com.google.common.collect.ImmutableSet<Color> keys()
      Returns a set of all the keys the player holds in their inventory. A player cannot carry more than 1 key of a given colour, so this is implemented as a Set.

    • remainingTreasures

      public int remainingTreasures()
      Returns the number of treasures that the player has yet to collect to complete the level.

    • position

      public Position position()
      Returns the current position vector of the player, relative to the level as specified in tiles.

    • position

      public void position(Position pos, Direction dir)
      Sets the player position.
      Parameters:
      pos - The position to set the player to.
      dir - The direction of translation.

    • newGame

      public static GameModel newGame()
      Creates a new GameModel, loading the first level.

    • newGameOnLevel

      public static GameModel newGameOnLevel(Level levelInfo)
      Creates a new GameModel using information from a provided level.
      Parameters:
      levelInfo - The level to load into the newly-created GameModel.

    • loadLevel

      public void loadLevel(Level levelInfo)
      Loads level information into this model, overwriting data, copying tiles, and clearing the game state.
      Parameters:
      levelInfo - The information of the new level to load.

    • insertAgents

      public void insertAgents()
      Inserts up to 5 agents at random free positions in the level.

    • fromSave

      public static GameModel fromSave(String mapId, Tile[][] tiles, int remainingTreasures, Position playerPosition, Set<Color> keysInInventory, List<Agent> agents)
      Creates an in-progress GameModel from saved game information.
      Parameters:
      mapId - The ID of the map that is being played.
      tiles - The current state of the board.
      remainingTreasures - The treasures left to collect.
      playerPosition - The position of the player when the game was saved.
      keysInInventory - The keys in the player's inventory.
      Returns:
      A GameModel that represents the game as it was when it was saved.

    • decrementRemainingTreasures

      public void decrementRemainingTreasures()
      Lowers remaining treasures by one.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when remaining treasures is equal to zero.

    • addPropertyChangeListener

      public void addPropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener listener)
      Adds a PropertyChangeListener instance to listen to model updates.

    • hasKey

      public boolean hasKey(Color colour)
      Determines whether the player currently holds a key of a given colour.

    • storeKey

      public void storeKey(Color colour)
      Stores a given key of a given colour.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the player already possesses a key of this colour.

    • setKeys

      public void setKeys(Set<Color> keys)
      Updates the list of keys.

    • resetKeys

      public void resetKeys()
      Drops all keys the player currently holds.

    • read

      public Tile read(Position position)
      Reads a position from the board and returns the Tile instance at that position.
      Returns:
      Returns null if the tile is outside the bounds of the map.

    • write

      public void write(Position position, Tile replacement)
      Writes a given Tile instance to the board at the given position, and signals to listeners that the tiles have changed.
